jillian g. meehan

making things on the internet

lickability

I’m an Operations Associate at Lickability, a small software studio based in New York.

We’ve worked on apps for clients including The Atlantic, Aloe Bud, Houseparty, and The New Yorker. We also have a few apps of our own—check out Pinpoint and Accelerator on the App Store!

I run the Lickability blog and social media accounts, and I’m learning to code apps in Swift.

Want to work with us on a project? Get in touch at jillian@lickability.net.

writing

The Hollywood Reporter: ‘Moana’ Deleted Songs and Scenes Detail Cut Brothers, Maui’s Past / 50 Hollywood Couples Open Up About Love and Relationships

Teen Vogue: How Wearing Makeup Helped Me Embrace My So-Called Imperfections / Growing Out A Pixie Cut: 10 Tips for Styling Short Hair

em Mag: Story of a Scent: On perfume and scent memories / NYFW Beauty: A Pop of Color: A look at some of the best NYFW SS17 beauty looks / The Minimal Wardrobe: On minimalism, Marie Kondo, the magic of the capsule wardrobe / BLACKOUT: Coverage of Emerson College’s annual EBONI fashion show / Extreme Fandom: On One Direction and the evolution of Twitter fandoms / Eulogy to Vine: On the end of an iconic app / Written in the Stars: On different perceptions of astrology

Femsplain: Who Are You, Really? / Some Nails Are Meant To Be Bitten / “Sleeping” Under The Sheets / Opening Up My Perfectly Lined Eyes / I Feel Better When I’m Naked And Alone / I May Be Quiet But I Have Plenty To Say

newsletter

Letters to Summer is a newsletter by two best friends.

If you’d like to get periodical updates about what we’re reading, watching, listening to, and enjoying, subscribe.

websites

Give with us is a platform for shoppers to connect with people who are donating their sales + commission to organizations they care about.

Laustrology is a no-bullshit astrology website that I built for my friend (and astrologist) Laura Tormos.

should i do this project? is a handy exercise for figuring out whether or not you should take on a new side project.

I also built Cassie Burge’s portfolio.

in-progress

I’m building SNAX, a zine about all things snacks. While SNAX is still in-progress, check out SNAX: Bite-Sized, a mini teaser of what’s to come. If you’d like to contribute to the zine (or join our Slack), get in touch at snaxreport.com.

contact

You can find me on Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn. (pls do not contact me via LinkedIn.)
